about.description:
AI2 Tango is a platform that allows you to build machine learning experiments
out of steps that can be reused and repeated. It eliminates duplicate work,
stores past results, and keeps track of how they were obtained so you can
quickly identify and trace back your best work. Experiments are flexible,
so you can change direction, pursue another idea and incorporate feedback,
without losing previous results. Write your own steps by wrapping common
Python functions, or take advantage of the library of pre-built steps for
training models, working with datasets, and running evaluations. It is
integrated with popular tools like the Huggingface transformers library,
PyTorch Lightning, and others.
about.summary: AI2 Tango replaces messy directories and spreadsheets full of file versions by organizing experiments into discrete steps that can be cached and reused throughout the lifetime of a research project.

name: tango-fairscale
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.9
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: tango-fairscale
  version: 0.9.1
source:
  patches:
    - patches/0001-delete-pyproject.toml.patch
    - patches/0002-relax-assumptions-about-elapsed-time-for-multicore-t.patch
    - patches/0003-Make-tests-runnable-out-of-tree-for-help-with-conda-.patch
  sha256: 232c46d80de43f917be123502f22c1ec2e3fb93627ee3c60d650cbc753e1c518
  url: https://github.com/allenai/tango/archive/refs/tags/v0.9.1.tar.gz
build:
  number: 0
  string: py38h578d9bd_0
requirements:
  host:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - bzip2 1.0.8 h7f98852_4
    - ca-certificates 2022.6.15 ha878542_0
    - ld_impl_linux-64 2.36.1 hea4e1c9_2
    - libffi 3.4.2 h7f98852_5
    - libgcc-ng 12.1.0 h8d9b700_16
    - libgomp 12.1.0 h8d9b700_16
    - libnsl 2.0.0 h7f98852_0
    - libuuid 2.32.1 h7f98852_1000
    - libzlib 1.2.12 h166bdaf_2
    - ncurses 6.3 h27087fc_1
    - openssl 3.0.5 h166bdaf_0
    - python 3.8.13 ha86cf86_0_cpython
    - readline 8.1.2 h0f457ee_0
    - sqlite 3.39.2 h4ff8645_0
    - tk 8.6.12 h27826a3_0
    - xz 5.2.5 h516909a_1
    - zlib 1.2.12 h166bdaf_2
  run:
    - fairscale =0.4.6
    - numpy
    - python >=3.8,<3.9.0a0
    - python_abi 3.8.* *_cp38
    - pytorch >=1.9.0,<1.12.0
    - tango 0.9.1 py38h578d9bd_0
test:
  commands:
    - pytest -v tests/integrations/fairscale
  imports:
    - tango.integrations.fairscale
  requires:
    - flaky
    - git
    - pytest
  source_files:
    - test_fixtures/
    - tests/
about:
  description: 'AI2 Tango is a platform that allows you to build machine learning
    experiments

    out of steps that can be reused and repeated. It eliminates duplicate work,

    stores past results, and keeps track of how they were obtained so you can

    quickly identify and trace back your best work. Experiments are flexible,

    so you can change direction, pursue another idea and incorporate feedback,

    without losing previous results. Write your own steps by wrapping common

    Python functions, or take advantage of the library of pre-built steps for

    training models, working with datasets, and running evaluations. It is

    integrated with popular tools like the Huggingface transformers library,

    PyTorch Lightning, and others.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/allenai/tango
  doc_url: https://ai2-tango.readthedocs.io
  home: https://github.com/allenai/tango
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: AI2 Tango replaces messy directories and spreadsheets full of file versions
    by organizing experiments into discrete steps that can be cached and reused throughout
    the lifetime of a research project.
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: tango
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - h-vetinari
